result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron T Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign medical releases for agent.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Aaron T Schultz in court, in custody, with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Sam Wegleitner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guity of Count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)  **CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE**
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2014 at 09:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Aaron T Schultz in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.    
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Preliminary hearing on June 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
